response.answer_text: Esports is an adolescent industry that doesn't control its own fate, it is less dying and more trying to work out what it is. You can't really measure death or life when the definition of what it is constantly changes. HardwareSoftwareSocial mentalityThese things are forever evolving but one thing remains constant and that is IP in the hands of developers. Unlike basketball where the NBA had to work hard to be the game industry leader, every developer of a game owns it…effectively they are inventing ‘basketball’ creating an industry that can never be like mainstream sports. What esports will become is nothing like what it is today, mainstream systems will absorb the industry, those who resist will be left behind. The end result will be a hybrid of mainstream sports and esports. Simulations of mainstream sports with game elements adding excitement & depth.

I hope so. Video games supposed to be entertaining and an escape from reality and from the stresses of life. Instead E-sports turning video game into a competitive events, filled with unnecessary stress (for the competitors) and possibility of gambling abuse. Many in the Internet already stating that competitive games like first person shooting (FPS) games creating toxic communities among youngsters. What should be a medium for youngsters to come together and enjoy virtual world had become a form of gladiator event, with sole purpose of entertaining morons sitting outside the arena and for those who involved in online gambling.
